basics.name: Gary Thomas
basics.label: Head of Technology and Architecture
basics.summary: Gary is originally from the UK, but has lived in Australia and New Zealand for the last 20 years. He originally studied Computer Science at Stafforshire University (or North Staffs Polytechnic as it was known back then) before starting his first job as a technologist (software engineer) at GPT in Liverpool, UK. Since then he has primarily worked in engineering, architecture and data in lots of different technologies with a focus on financial services and payments.

work.name: Lab49
work.description: Technology consultancy specialising in Financial Services
work.summary: Lab49 is a technology consultancy specialising in Financial Services specialising in Digital, Blockchain, Product innovation and Simplification. Gary Led the technology architecture and engineering practice for Lab49 across Australia, New Zealand, UAE, and the wider Asia Pacific region. Developed a technology practice, driving technology strategy and guiding high-performing teams.
highlights: Led the design and delivery of an end-to-end digital transformation for a major corporate and institutional bank, leveraging an event-driven microservices architecture and cloud native technologies.
Developed a technology roadmap and architecture framework for a major Australian bank, aligning with modern architecture and strategic goals
Built a data strategy to support the creation of a bank-wide analytics capability for an Australian Bank.
Delivered a technology strategy and merger plan for a digital asset and investment company.
Built and led a multi-region team of over 20 architects and principal engineers across solution, integration, security, and data disciplines.

work.name: Verifone
work.summary: Verifone are a global payment company with a long history of point-of-sale innovation and payment services.
highlights: Led the design and development of payment architectures globally with a focus on the architecture of a new global platform for payment processing to be deployed across multiple regions in a hybrid model.
Architected a multi-region, cloud native, event-driven payment data processing platform using Kafka and microservices on AWS
Established API-first architecture patterns for customer onboarding and integration working with Kong for API Management
Designed and led the execution of cloud migration strategies for critical payment processing systems
Designed and coded payment gateways to support AS2805 and other local requirements

work.name: Allianz
work.summary: Allianz is a global insurance company with a long history of insurance innovation and insurance services.
highlights: Led the implementation of a new insurance rating engine and pricing services used across the business.
Defined new standards for external services based on industry standards - ACORD, ISO, etc.
